This noon the siren

Mr. Johnson, Mr. Peck

Next to

a large Chinese grave yard with lots

The nearby Chinese
farmers,
ricksha coolies and servants all congregate
there when an alarm sounds.
They
coMe
there for

grave

to be near the American flag which they at least think affords them some measure
of protection.
The
noise of the motors became louder and presently
out of the
clouds to
the south three Japanese twin-motored bombers came into view - below
the
clouds at about 6000 feet.
The sky was about 95 percent overcast at that
altitude and only infrequent holes showed & light blue against the gray which
of course predominated.
The three bombers came directly at us then turned away
toward the airport outside the wall, where no doubt more paper planes had been
